intro: Ophiorrhiza larseniorum, commonly known as the Malabar sandalwood, is a tropical shrub native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is adapted to coastal and sandy soils, often growing in humid, tropical environments. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
